Reviews.Title: Why I love this laptop
Reviews.Author: TellingYouLikeItIs
Reviews.Content: I've gotten several laptops in my lifetime.  And, this is the best one I've gotten so far.  Nothing really stands out but it's just altogether well made.  When you strike the keys, it feels very nice.  The picture quality of the screen is good.  Programs load up pretty quickly.  Every laptop I've purchased I have regretted.  I bought a laptop that was small and lightweight.  I  thought that it would be great to carry around.  But, I learned that ease of carrying it around doesn't justify the small screen.  Then, I went the other way and bought a huge screen.  But, the weight made it so cumbersome.  For example, just typing on your lap was annoying.  But, this laptop seems perfect.  Light, good screen size, and programs work perfect.  Here are some points that I hope helps you make a decision.Pros:1. Touchpad.  I love the touchpad.  Very responsive.  And you can scroll up/down and sideways by using two fingers.  Never seen that before!  Of course, you can zoom in and out by bringing your fingers together and out.Cons:1. low battery life.  After a few hours of web surfing, you'll have to replug.  My other laptops lasted much longer right after purchasing.  (After a year or two, all of my laptops' batteries just sucked.)

Reviews.Title: A great entry level laptop
Reviews.Author: Camelot One
Reviews.Content: The Intel version is considerably faster than the AMD E-450 model, which carries the same price. The only downside is a cut in battery life, the AMD gets a little over 4 hours, while I could only get about 3 out of this one. That is under constant use browsing web pages, and using wifi.It is no speed demon, but it gets the job done. The display has good color, and is bright enough for use outdoors. The USB 3.0 port is a nice touch.Before Windows 8 was released, this model was selling for $329, and could often be found on sale for $299. And at that price, it is an amazing machine. But at today's nearly $400 price, there might be other options to consider.

Reviews.Title: Excellent computer for the price
Reviews.Author: TheMrs0724 "mama2four"
Reviews.Content: My sister, a high school student, needed to replace her junky netbook with a real computer, so I ordered this one for her figuring it was just perfect for a student.We received the computer in two days (thank you, Prime), plugged it in, and started setting it up. My husband was so impressed with the Asus computer that he preferred it to our Toshiba AND our HP laptops. In fact, he spent nearly all of Thanksgiving break playing around on her computer. Speakers are good, graphics are good, and I genuinely prefer Windows 7 to Windows 8, which was probably *the* deciding factor in choosing this Asus laptop over several other models in this price point, most of which were equipped with Windows 8. Keep in mind this was during the week of Black Friday, so there were tons of deals on laptops, but this one seemed like the best buy to me, and I was right.She absolutely loves the computer. We got her set up with a free 60-day trial of Microsoft Home and Student, which is actually my only complaint, that computers don't come with software like that anymore! Not anything against the computer itself, just against the current market and the unfortunate situation that puts many broke students like herself in...having to shell out an extra $100+ for software just so they can write a paper or create a presentation.Bottom line: Buy it! This was a great buy for her, and my husband was so impressed with the Asus that I bought him one for Christmas to replace the 1 year old HP laptop that bit the dust...

Reviews.Title: Repaired and is working...
Reviews.Author: subrosa
Reviews.Content: Purchased this laptop at the end of July and after 4 weeks the monitor died.  Shipped it at my expense to get repaired and it was returned to me in worse condition than when I sent it in.  Sure the "repair" was free but what good was it?  New repair is pending...So far I'm not impressed, let's see how this next repair goes.  Seriously, shouldn't they have just replaced the entire machine?  If they take care of me I'll be sure to post here to let all know.  Will keep you posted...Update...11/15/2012I just received the re-repaired laptop last week and I'm pleased to say that after leaving it on for a few days and using it the problem has been fixed. I'm pleased it's now fixed although I still believe it wasn't fair for me to have to pay almost $65.00 in total shipping charges when the product was only 4 weeks in my possession. Other than this the computer has worked well and I can recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Used a couple of Months
Reviews.Author: Jet "Jet"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this laptop for a couple of months, and I really love it.  My last two laptops were a Toshiba and an HP.  Both were relatively inexpensive at around $500 and they both felt really cheap.  Both also died around the 3 year mark.  I literally had tape holding the HP together at the end, and it barely ever left my coffee table. The toshiba was physically ok at the end, but totally crashed and could not be recovered even after bringing it to computer repair people.  While I don't know what the longevity of this Asus will be, it feels and looks so much better out of the box, even though it is the least expensive.  The screen is beautiful.  It is fairly light for such a large computer.  The battery life isn't great, but I am so used to the batteries on my last laptops loosing their charge after a year or so that I am happy to have any battery life.  Programs were easy to instal.  I really like the feel of the keyboard and track pad.  Someone mentioned that the volume is too low, but that can be adjusted with the pre-installed desktop icon that says "Asus Sonic Foccus."  I actually think the sound quality is pretty decent.  Overall, my computing needs are pretty basic.  This computer is great for the basic stuff.  Of course, it runs slow until  you install all of the windows updates, but as soon as you have installed all windows updates and an anti-virus program, you should be trouble free as I have been.  This is the first laptop that I have actually been excited about in many years.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Haug-West
Reviews.Content: I do my major computing on a Dell desktop, but I needed an affordable laptop for portability around the house and occasional travel. I'm very pleased so far with this one's performance. The screen is quite large and the quality of graphics & videos is more than good enough for my basic needs. (I can't speak to how it would be for gaming, since I don't do any of that.) This is a fine choice and good value.

Reviews.Title: A great laptop for home users
Reviews.Author: Andy in Utah
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife who likes to check email, browse the internet, write blogs, watch Netflix, and other simple tasks. Has a quick, Intel dual-core processor with power to do everything she wants.  She also does Quicken and loves the 10-key on the keyboard.  Very nice, bright screen that is adjustable for when you want to watch a movie at night and not blind yourself :). Fast wireless 802.11bgn/wired network cards. This is perfect for a typical home user not into heavy gaming. I do wish is that this had a light-up keyboard for use when it is dark. I bought her a flexible USB light from Amazon for $6 to remedy this.*** The included ASUS 360 warranty is great. Full 1-year parts\labor\accidental drops, spills, power surge, fire warranty. 24x7 tech support with 3 business day replacement turnaround. Hope I don't have to use it, but that's great peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: UPDATE: 11 months after unboxing, replaced Windows with Ubuntu Server 13.04
Reviews.Author: Mike F
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: I WAS ABOUT TO DONATE THIS JUNK BUT REPLACING BLOATED WINDOWS WITH A NEW LINUX OS SAVED THE DAY!1)  RELEASE POWER BUTTON TAPPING ESCAPE KEY REPEATEDLY TO INSTALL FROM DVD UBUNTU SERVER 13.04 picking a login id with no spaces, i.e. mikeflores2)  AFTER INSTALLING THE BASIC SERVER OPERATING SYSTEM, LOGIN AND TYPE COMMANDSsudo apt-get updatesudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktopsudo rebootTHE RESULT:  NO VIRUS, WORMS, SPYWARE, ADWARE; JUST A VERY FAST AND COOL NOTEBOOK WITH MORE POWER THAN AN IBM RS6000.Pros:Excellant value and solid notebook.Keyboard and numeric keypad.EZ to install optional 4G memory bank to double RAM; just make sure to press in until a spring loaded click is heard.ASUS support ( via email ) is prompt and effective.Weighs about the same as a MacBook Pro.Cons:Face recognition Logon worked only once.440G hard disk drive is not 500G as advertisedSlow to boot and in overall operation including opening browserConstant Windows 7 home premium updates and annoying threats of viruses.Keyboard stopped working totally and chat support misdiagnosed as a hardware failureMaybe these steps fixed dead keyboard or my changing something on the mouse pad driver setting:You are going to do a hard reset on the unit:I want you to power down the unit.I want you to remove the ac adapter.I want you to remove the battery.I want you to hold down the power button for 30 seconds.This will discharge any static on the motherboard that could becausing the issue.Replace the battery and adapter and verify if the issue is still present.Take my advice, if you only need to run your Windows software like Microsoft Project then getCrossOver for the MacBook Pro.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight, Wide Screen, but Keyboard is too small
Reviews.Author: Rachel W
Reviews.Content: Pros:(1) Lightweight. I wouldn't say it is as light as the Apple laptop, but it is very portable. I can easily lie on my bad or couch holding it, and surf online or watch a movie.(2) Wide screen. Makes it ideal to watch DVD.Cons:(1) Keyboard is smaller. If your fingers are used to typing at the regular-sized keyboard, you'd have to re-adapt to typing in this computer. Initially, I kept typing wrong words because of this reason. The keyboard also feels cheap.(2) Face logon only works once - that's true! It becomes a bother when it doesn't work, as you'd have to key in password manually.But for this price, I'd still say that it's a good buy overall.***************** UPDATES (AFTER A FEW MONTHS): ***************************I have decided to take the stars off. It has been very disappointing!(1) The color is off. Green appears fainter than normal and no matter how I adjust hue and saturation, the color never seems to look right.(2) For a laptop of these specs, it should perform quite quickly, but it does not. I do not have many applications running but it is slower than my older laptop with half the ram and 1/3 less the processor speed.(3) No Bluetooth???(4) It cannot detect my cell phone as hardware. It works on my husband's 4 year old laptop on the first connect. What gives???Hence, reduce to 1 star... I wouldn't recommend this model. I would rather spend a couple hundreds more for a real deal. This, despite its price, is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: TheITMan
Reviews.Content: EDIT -------A few days later and now I'm starting to have issues with the screen. It looks like some pixels are missing or frozen. It's random, and I can't tell if it's the computer or the operating system that is glitching out. I have some screen shots, I sent off to ASUS to see what they say.Doesn't look like I can attach screen shots here.EDIT -------I've updated my review to give this a 3 out of 5, instead of a 1. I'm still upset about the disc not being sent with the computer and not being able to reinstall Windows, but some of that is Microsoft's fault as well. Also, most manufactures don't include discs anymore (which is stupid since you can't even make a recovery disc either), so that's not really an ASUS issue. Any laptop is going to be like that now.When I plugged in a USB mouse I was able to navigate the operating system better, even though it's still confusing because Microsoft changed everything around.I used the computer all night last night to talk to one of my friends on Yahoo Messenger, and to surf the internet for homework and it worked pretty well for that.So for a basic model that is cheap, if you're going to be using the internet and things like email, it's probably going to be okay. But don't expect to do a lot more then that with it. I guess for the price you can't expect much more anyway.Now I just need to see how long this thing will last. If I have any problems with the computer or anything, I will update this review. If there are no updates here, then everything is still working well.  Posted  2/4/2013ORIGINAL BELOW ------I like the computer, it has a nice keyboard that is easy to use. It's not really that fast, when you are instaling udpates and things like that. It took me over 20 mins sitting at the library just to install windows updates.The Asus Live Update program is SO ANNOYING. It pops up without warning and takes over your screen and starts downloading files, without even asking if it's okay. I can be in the middle of typing something and BAM an update screen is in my face with focus set to it, so I can't type anymore.There is no way to backup the system. Asus tech support told me to use the AI Recovery program (or what ever it was called) to burn the DVD to backup the system. But after I couldn't find it, I did some checking to find out that, it's no longer included with this model.So they told me to use the Windows 8 disc image utility to create a backup of my system image... Well... Low and Behold, Microsoft took out that utility in the public release of Windows 8, so that's also impossible.1. Doesn't come with any discs, so if I need to reinstall the operating system I'm *****ed. Sure they tell you that it's included on a seperate partition of the hard drive, but WHAT IF THE HARD DRIVE CRASHES??2. Okay, so use the Asus utility to create a backup of your system, just in case, OH WAIT that was removed form this model.3. Okay! No problem! I'll just use the Windows 8 utility to create a backup of the system image. OH WAIT!!!! That was removed from the operating system as well.Manufactures don't even give you a disc anymore, which is so stupid because the disc can't cost more than 2 cents. I paid for the computer. I want my disc.It's just a scam to get you to buy a new computer and/or new operating system if you ever need to reinstall. I guess if anything ever happens to this computer, I have 2 choices, either send it back to ASUS and be without my computer for a week or two waiting for the shipping of the laptop, or go to the store and by a new copy of Windows 8.The other thing is that is has Windows 8 installed on it. Which is designed for a tablet computer. Most of the functions tell me "swipe the screen to activate this feature." "swipe to do this" "swipe to do that" I tried swiping for 15 mins, before I realized that THIS ISN'T A TOUCH SCREEN MONITOR. So how the heck can I navigate most of the operating system?

Reviews.Title: Unsatisfied
Reviews.Author: Melanie Hollander
Reviews.Content: Everything about this laptop was fine and very much what I expected as far as quality. However, when I tried to connect to the internet through the wireless adapter, it would not connect. I tried every possible troubleshooting technique and even called my IPS to find a solution, but to no avail. Every other computer I own  connects just fine. It was only this one that would not work. Sadly I am returning the product.

Reviews.Title: bad product
Reviews.Author: Sasha
Reviews.Content: First it was just uploading and restarting over and over again,couldnt even use it first day...next day it said "cant recognize hardwer's ID" and died...I was never able to turn it on again...Also,everytime you touch this computer you can see your fingerprint and its haaard to wipe it off (???).Returned.

Reviews.Title: A good cheap laptop
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: So far I like the laptop. Asus makes great motherboards so I gave them a chance with a this laptop. Fairly fast and good graphics for the price.Drawbacks, Asus dropped he ball on amazon when it said the system can use 2X 4gs memory. It only has one memory slot. So I had to send back my extra 4g memory and get a single 8g upgrade.Intel hogs the battery life. I will buy another battery when I have a day of flying.Windows 8's interface is so clunky its awful. By far the worse thing on this computer. Some of the core components of 8 are an improvement.

Reviews.Title: YOU WILL LOVE THIS PC.
Reviews.Author: rabo
Reviews.Content: tHIS MACHINE WAS A GREAT VALUE WHEN I BOUGHT IT & IT HAS PERFORMED PERFECTLY FOR ALMOST A YEAR, NOW. IT IS FAST & RELIABLE WITH GOOD BATTERY LIFE. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.

Reviews.Title: Has issues
Reviews.Author: PAUL WEBER
Reviews.Content: Got for son going to college.  Liked that it had Windows 7  and good basic features for the money.  Seemed ok at first. With in a month of using it started to attempt to log off on its own. Continually tries to log off but will not actually do it . Asus cust . service helped with walking us through some steps that got it going, for a couple days. My son reports he has had to pull battery and go through these steps to get it working numerous times the past few weeks.Seems these steps only help short term. Would not reccommend . Very dissapointed

Reviews.Title: Not ASUS quality
Reviews.Author: Katherine Eberhardt "kathy"
Reviews.Content: ASUS A54C-AB91 15.6-Inch Laptop (Black)I ordered this laptop as a Christmas gift for my adult daughter. First the wifi would not connect. Amazon immediately sent a replacement in time for Christmas. But now (6 months later), the battery won't charge. My son-in-law who has a degree in Computer Science and works on PCs, opened it up and said that several components were not mounted correctly. Screws missing etc. So we are going with another brand this time around.I guess low price means low quality in this case.

Reviews.Title: Do not Buy This Computer!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Stacy
Reviews.Content: This is the second one. I returned the 1st because there was a problem with the touch pad. It would not track when plugged in. I returned it, Thanks Amazon for being such a great store, The second one does the same thing. I also lost some files because the file library stopped working.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: Richard Elliott
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop so far. Everything i was hoping for.  Very easy to use. Im going to order another one for my son.

Reviews.Title: More than adequately utilitarian
Reviews.Author: Craig Reynolds "Older Ace"
Reviews.Content: Relied on the ASUS and Intel names for the cheapest notebook/laptop I could find for my minimal requirements in applications - word processing, spreadsheet, simple games - and stern demands for internet - fast processing speed for near-instantaneous response in connectivity and good streaming audio/video - and could not be more pleased with this machine. Thrilled to find basic WP and Spreadsheet programs included with MS OS-Windows 7, saving a lot of grief. Materials for the keyboard and its surround are lightweight, almost flimsy, but I am not going to be beating this unit up like others I've had in the past, so that's OK. Display is very good but with somewhat narrow view angles. Very prompt delivery from amazon.com with the thing ready to go out of the box, but no documentation/manuals - etc, so you'd best know what you're doing when you get it. Don't know about battery power as it's been juiced straight through the AC/DC adaptor since I got it, but I suspect it will not run long on the smallish battery.  Sufficient ports for simple use. All around, a more than decent machine for all basic applications, and then some.

Reviews.Title: Not enough memory
Reviews.Author: T. Rawlins
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with this laptop when I first received it. I tried it out on a couple of games that my kids like to play and the graphics ran so much smoother than the last laptop we had. The only problem that we have enountered with this laptop is that after playing one particular game for awhile, it runs out of memory and closes the game. As any gamer would know, this is not acceptable, so I'm going to have to muy more memory for it. This laptop is still fantastic for the price and would buy it again, but buyer beware, if you plan to use it for gaming, be prepared to buy additional memory.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Paul Daniels
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my daughter - checked it out first to make sure everthing was ok and it was - she reports that she really likes it as well. One point is that I read and listened to reviews that said to avoid Windows 8 unless you have a touch screen computer - so I purposely got this with Windows 7 and am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Hard drive failed within 2 months
Reviews.Author: Juan Palacio
Reviews.Content: The machine worked OK, I thought it was a little bit slow for what it had inside. Also, 2 months after purchase the hard drive failed and had to send it back.  2-3 weeks without it.

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: JESS
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife and it seems to be plenty of computer for what we paid for it.  ($329 at the time)  This is the second ASUS machine we have bought, and the third we have had plenty of time around, and I am so far impressed with how their computers are put together.  The performance is good, but we are not asking for much, so I can't say a lot about that.  What impresses me most are the physical features of these ASUS machines.  They so far all seem both strong and light, even this one, as a 15-incher, is about 2/3 the weight of the Dell computer it replaced, which was exactly the same size.  The other thing that impresses me is how well these machines seem to get rid of heat, the palm areas stay very cool, and the bottom of the computer gets warm at best, not hot like our Dells did.  I have heard that ASUS makes parts for Mac, and that does not surprise me.  I have not heard the best things about their customer service, but if they continue to be the excellent machines they have been so far, we won't need any customer service.  They just work!

Reviews.Title: Asus A54C-AB91 Laptop - Son really likes it!
Reviews.Author: Elifino
Reviews.Content: Bought it for a Christmas present and it was a hit!  He needed a laptop for college and this fits the bill.  It's not a gamer's laptop, but it will play DVD movies without a skip and office runs just fine on it.

Reviews.Title: Seems to be performing
Reviews.Author: Donal Fagan
Reviews.Content: I have the A53E with Linux, and I bought this for a relative who needed to keep Windows to run some software. When I have time I plan to make it a dual-boot system for her.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for the money.
Reviews.Author: Bill Browne "Bill near Boston"
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this laptop and Asus in general.  I am not a fan of Windows 7, but for the money, I am satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Easiest setup ever!
Reviews.Author: Anne Riverside "Anne"
Reviews.Content: Found this as an amazon deal and loving the choice I made.  I have several laptops, all HP, and I love this one best so far (and it was the most inexpensive)!!

Reviews.Title: Good So Far
Reviews.Author: Melynda Sidel
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a little over 3 months ago and so far so good. I have no complaints other than the face recognition feature is a little hit and miss, but I don't mind typing in my password.

Reviews.Title: Nice Looking Laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop (LT) to replace an old IBM Thinkpad Laptop that lasted for 10 years (yes, 10 years). The price vs features for this Asus LT was too good to be true so I took a chance and I purchased it for $350 from Amazon.com. So far this LT is operating very well - no problems so far. It came with an Intel processor, 4GB RAM,  a 457GB HDD that is divided into two volumes (C & D Drives), 2 USB ports, a high speed internet port, a SVGA port, and 1 HDMI port.The screen and keyboard are both HUGE and they make this LT very easy to use - much easier than my old laptop. The web surfing speed is excellent and Macafee Anti-virus comes pre-installed. I connect to the internet via the ethernet port so I can't speak about WIFI connectivity.The LT is extremely light and I suppose that is an asset. However, I am use to the heavy IBM LT's and I personally associate weight with durability - right or wrong. I give this computer 4 stars so far and I may give it a higher or lower rating based on it's future performance and durability.The only minor issue is that it would have been nice for Asus to mark the left & right click buttons with a white or red line on the button itself because these buttons are hard to see while using the laptop in a dim or dark environment (the left & right click buttons are the same color as the laptop - black).  However, right now I am a very satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: Great computer for the casual user.
Reviews.Author: G. d'Arbonne "Greg d'"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife who mainly uses it for e-mail and word processing and surfing the net as needed. Lightweight, easy to use and inexpensive. No problems with it at all.

Reviews.Title: Good Value for Price
Reviews.Author: Jorge O. Espejo
Reviews.Content: The laptop certainly gives you great value for the price. Initial non familiarity with Windows 8 sometimes makes going between program tabs annoying. Good sound from the unit compared to other brands. After a years use keyboard has shown signs of cross contacts so sometimes, as an example, you press "e" and you get the result as if you pressed "windows e". Overall, though my wife is quite happy with the unit.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!!!
Reviews.Author: poochie
Reviews.Content: this purchase was just a whole lot of problems...didnt get what i ordered...this laptop doesnt even have bluetooth...kmt please buy anyother laptop but this!!!

Reviews.Title: cant use because it came with no charger
Reviews.Author: steven
Reviews.Content: well it didnt necessarily work out for me, ordered the laptop, once it got to my house the seal on the inside box that contained the actuall laptop had a broken seal on it and once i looked inside it, there were 2 bags which i am to assume contained the charger for it but there was nothing inside of it. so im left with a laptop but i cant do anything on it. now i have to go buy a new charger for it.

Reviews.Title: Stinks- worst ever
Reviews.Author: Mak
Reviews.Content: Had to be sent back to Asus TWICE within the first 6 months of ownership.  Asus would not give us a replacement.  They had to wipe it clean and reload everything- and then do it again a second time two weeks after we received it back from them. It is not used for anything but the internet and documents and it is very slow.

Reviews.Title: Did not last 1 year
Reviews.Author: Robin Pfender
Reviews.Content: Regrettably, this laptop has not lasted one year.  It was purchased in January, 2013 and it crashed in October, 2013.  It was purchased to be used by my daughter at college and it has let her down near semester end and finals.  I thought...surely we have a warranty, right?  Well, the 'fine print' is that if you did not register for warranty service within 60 days of purchasing the laptop then you're ineligible to file a claim.  I should have read the fine print but really, I thought the computer would last longer than the one year warranty!Too, too bad.

Reviews.Title: Just Ok
Reviews.Author: koen "koen"
Reviews.Content: This is an all-around solid PC that is tough as nails. I bought it for my wife for Christmas and she is very hard on computers. She's had it for about one year and we have never had a single problem with it. It starts up relatively quickly, had been dropped and banged around more than once and it always starts on the first try. We have not had to reboot it or contact customer service at all. Granted, we run Norton Anti-Virus on it but that's the price you pay for a Windows machine. Personally, I would never buy another Windows machine, but if you're going to the Asus is a fine option. In fact, unlike this computer, Dells and HPs that I have owned had more problems than in one year than this one has had. I would buy an Asus again if I were going to buy a PC, which I'm not, because Macs are superior to all PCs irrespective of the manufacturer. Also, I'd note that this one has a great battery life and runs a lot cooler than older laptops I've owned. The only drawback on this PC is that the volume/speakers is really low. Perhaps I'm doing something wrong but the speakers seem very weak.UPDATE:It's been a few days over a year since I bought this, a few days past the Asus warranty, and the computer totally crashed and is stuck on the Windows welcome screen. I do not know if this is the software or the hardware, however, doing some research on Google showed that other Asus owners have experienced the same thing. And of course, it is not covered by the "Square Trade" warranty I bought. I bought the Asus because my friend had good luck with an Acer so I thought I'd get the same results with another Asian branded PC. However, I wouldn't buy another Asus at this point.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ray Velasquez
Reviews.Content: It is good to play on the net. But you must be aware of where your fingers and palms sit. Do not like the mouse pad at all, always locking the mouse in the scroll and it gets annoying.

Reviews.Title: Good product, works as I expected
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: This is a very good item. Was a gift for my parents and I see it gets used often when I visit them.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Steven Lee
Reviews.Content: I didn't need a powerhouse and only something that can handle internet related tasks. This did the trick and is exceedingly reliable. Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: No problems
Reviews.Author: ldw120
Reviews.Content: I wanted a computer with Windows 7, this model had it. This is actually the second A54 I purchased, the other was for my wife. No problems with either computer.I needed to buy usb hubs since the machine only has two ports, but those are inexpensive additions. I tend to use ancillary equipment like printers, scanners, mouse, keyboard with hard wires instead of wireless so I need the hubs.Computer booted up quickly and for my purposes, meets all expectations. You do need to buy MS Office and a Virus program so add a couple hundred to the price. Still worth it.

Reviews.Title: New computer
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "bookworm"
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my new computer though Windows 8 is a pain sometimes. I had my Dell for only 2.5 years and so I am eager to see how long this one lasts.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: John Chisholm
Reviews.Content: Great laptop for the money.  Would recommend. View screen very sharp and runs cool.  Battery life excellent.  Not sure about speed as iM not a gamer.

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Steve Peterson
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my mother-in-law and she loves it. The set up was easy and the wi-fi was a snap.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the Money, But-
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: the keyboard is not standard. I read that in a review before purchasing, but didn't think much about it. However, after working all day on a standard keyboard, and then transitioning to this one, I make 10 times the number of typos... Also, the USB ports are side-by-side, and are so close together that I cannot use both my printer USB cable and a another peripheral (flash drive) at the same time. Only two of the four USB connectors for the peripherals I would tend to use at the same time, fit. Even though the laptop otherwise operates reasonably well for the money, for what I do (web surfing/research, word, excel, ...), I would not have bought it for those reasons.

Reviews.Title: Fine for the price/value - but mouse and number pad are annoying
Reviews.Author: Rich Y.
Reviews.Content: Powerful laptop and performance is great for the price. Two annoyances though now that I've had this for over 3 months. The mouse is a little finicky and I'm not sure if this is tied to windows 8 (is there a special swipe gesture on the touch pad that causes switching back and forth between open windows????), as certain movements on the touch pad cause the screen to switch to another window. Second is the physical hardware of the number pad - it is just awkwardly placed and quite frankly I'm not sure why a laptop has a number pad. It takes up a lot of space and causes a lot of mistyping. As far as Windows 8 goes, it is actually a pretty slick user interface, but there are simply not enough apps to make it interesting. You can always fall back on "desktop mode" which is like Windows 7/VIsta if you don't particularly care for it.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: J. Hub
Reviews.Content: This computer isn't the actual one I ordered and when I contacted Asus they said they didn't have the one advertised.  Well shame on them for false advertising.  Kept it anyway and it's been an OK computer at least it doesn't have windows 8, that's one good feature.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: gsmooth
Reviews.Content: This laptop is a great deal for the price may not look fancy put hads the power to do what you need. Since it is a good size laptop the keyboard seam longer when typing. Once you get use to it. You are fine. With the hdmi output you can plug right into your big screen for bigger viewing .

Reviews.Title: Great Product/Great Value
Reviews.Author: Joseph L. Ovalle
Reviews.Content: We love our new laptop--blazing speed and at under $400, this was a great purchase for us.  Windows 8 is different, so it will take us some time to get acclimated to the new OS.

Reviews.Title: Excelente adqusición
Reviews.Author: Petra Flores
Reviews.Content: Excelente equipo. Me encanta por cuanto trae la configuración del idioma, un teclado cómodo y además tiene el windows 8

Reviews.Title: GREAT value!
Reviews.Author: R. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I wanted an inexpensive laptop for home use (I have other computers).  I have always liked ASUS and so was biased towards purchasing an ASUS when looking for a laptop to purchase.  Given the price of this model I was very suprised at the performance.  It has more performance than I need for my uses which include streaming video, surfing the web, running application software like word processors, etc.  I do not know how the laptop would perform for gaming or more stressing applications.  The ASUS quick start is also fantastic and actually works (something Microsoft has failed to do with a slow start for many years).ASUS also met my expectations on quality.  The laptop seems light but sturdy with a very nice keyboard and touchpad.  I would recommend this laptop to anyone looking for a good, basic laptop.CONS;  Given the price I don't have many cons and rate this laptop as 5 stars (this is an inexpensive laptop). The laptop does have an LCD display which makes off-angle viewing poor and may impact battery life.  The display resolution is only 768 pixels high which can require scrolling for some web pages (horizontal resolution is great).  The speakers seem to have low volume though I rarely use them.  Battery life seems to be 2-3 hours.  I may spring for the LED display version for my next laptop though.Overall I love the laptop and it exceeded my expectations.  I would purchase the laptop again and definitely consider another ASUS.

Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop
Reviews.Author: Juan J. Melendez Amaro "Pachicho"
Reviews.Content: Strong desing and graphics really run fast, I use this machine for general propose, search in the web,work with Databases and excel,have a very good response time, really like this laptop

Reviews.Title: Awesome buy!
Reviews.Author: ezztek
Reviews.Content: I use this laptop for watching movies on my big screen tv.  I use it for programming on my job and with the memory upgrade to 8 gig it's faster than my work PC.  All this for about 400.00 that is an awesome buy!

Reviews.Title: Good for the price!
Reviews.Author: Hubert Walton
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son going to college.  The outside is cheaper plastic, so you have to make sure the screen doesn't come undone. Overall good value.

Reviews.Title: husbands laptop
Reviews.Author: Sandra K.
Reviews.Content: Got this for my husband. He uses it everyday for farming information. He says it is very user friendly. I like to take it withus if we go on short trips.

Reviews.Title: Keyboard stiff, track pad overly sensitive
Reviews.Author: C. Hindin
Reviews.Content: Pc is ok but ...stiffest keyboard I've ever used, track pad verrrry sensitiveI wound up buying a separate keyboard and mouse.

Reviews.Title: what is not to like
Reviews.Author: Palgume "If the shoe fits wear it"
Reviews.Content: love it (customer does)wifi is stablealot of garbagesnappy (it would be awesome on SSD)CPU IS GREAT

Reviews.Title: great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Raf
Reviews.Content: I love it is fast and reliable very light and very good product. widen screen very brilliantine and clear image

Reviews.Title: great price & product
Reviews.Author: Harvey Rumstein
Reviews.Content: really love this neat unit. works well, is lightweght & got it at grt price to boot. recommend it for all.

Reviews.Title: Laptop
Reviews.Author: gorilla11
Reviews.Content: Very nice laptop. Does everything my son had hoped and more. His old computer was losing ground and couldn't accept new programs. Very happy with upgraded Windows.

Reviews.Title: all good
Reviews.Author: Andres Mendez
Reviews.Content: muy buena maquina porel precio. es rapida y muy buen tamaño de pantalla, lo unico que falta es mejorarle un poco la bateria

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop as a gift for my Fiance, so she would have a computer to use while around the house. The performance is just fine for simple web browsing and doing general tasks on a computer. The price was good and I feel this will be a nice laptop to have around for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money!
Reviews.Author: prettyMBA
Reviews.Content: Bought this for myself for Christmas and as of 02/19/2013, great so far. The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the uncontrollable automatic scroll it does if you move your finger in a certain way on the mouse pad. I haven't figured out how to keep that from happening. Otherwise great for everyday use, facebook gaming, students, etc.

Reviews.Title: It's pretty good.
Reviews.Author: Susan Lind
Reviews.Content: The touch pad is too sensitive.  Also, if you type too fast,the keys scramble and end up in other locations.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: Took the better part of a day to remove windows 8.  Asus does not provide a means to make a reinstall discs like most other manufactures nor do they offer an option to buy recovery discs.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Laptop
Reviews.Author: Arline A. Jelley
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed the laptop, find it easy to use, and very fast.  Online instructions helped with key usage.  I would recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Will need repairing after 6 months!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this low price laptop for my 12 year old son for Christmas. He uses it daily and it does fine with video playback from the internet as well as gaming. We have had no issues so far and do highly recommend this model. Perfect for internet use and homework for the average student. This laptop would be great for the the every day person surfing the net or managing a household as well. We paid $299.00 for it as a lightning deal and were very skeptical considering the low price. However....If it holds up to a kids abuse for over a month with no issues it deserves 5 stars! Buy with confidence!update....Power adapter stopped working on laptop after 6 months of use. Found a replacement on eBay (obviously others have had the same issue) for $3.49. I will perform the repair myself but what a bummer!Replaced it and now working without issues....Because repair is not for the novice, I no longer recommend this laptop even though it now does work fine again.

Reviews.Title: Poorly Designed Key Pad
Reviews.Author: timothy c. delpapa
Reviews.Content: The key board is awkward and I find myself retyping over and over.  The touchpad/mouse is too big and my palms hit it, thus bouncing the cursor all over.  All I really need a computer for is to send and receive email and go on the internet.  This suits my needs, but the key pad is horrible.

Reviews.Title: encountered some problems...
Reviews.Author: J. Lister
Reviews.Content: Good laptop, but encountered problems with pages freezing and certain sights that wont load the first time. Speakers are not the best either so would recommend using headphones when listening to music. It's light in weight, so that's a plus though.

Reviews.Title: gift for mom
Reviews.Author: Dawn "Dawn"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my parents for Christmas, it is easy for a new laptop user and the ASUS name is very trustworthy. My husband has the same version in a slightly older model and loves it.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: kelly
Reviews.Content: This laptop has given me no trouble and has been very useful to me at home, I enjoy it very much.

Reviews.Title: just got it great start for now
Reviews.Author: Angeleyes
Reviews.Content: nice and fast easy to install am so happy i might another another one great price also very light. great programs  great start for now

Reviews.Title: New laptop, new Win 8
Reviews.Author: Jesus O.
Reviews.Content: This laptop is lighter, the screen good size and colors brighter. I have to get used to WIN 8 but is ok by now. I would like the speaker louder, I bought this to replace my old HP, it sounds better, although the both have Altec speaker the sound is different. Menu amazing. The browsing faster and battery life almost 5 hours. Maybe in a few days, I will add more details. Thank u Amazon, Thank u Assus  and Thanks seller.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Dustin King
Reviews.Content: For the amount I paid, this is a huge step up fro my previous computer.  Most of the things I need to do with it I can do, but it still doesn't run a couple of games due to them being graphics intensive.

Reviews.Title: computer
Reviews.Author: Maynard M. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: The computer is great, but I had a hard time understanding the web 8, It's totally new I  finally learned it, now its excellent.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: lmatthewj
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a good machine.  Given the specs it's a really good value.  It's nothing extraordinary or fancy but get's the job done when it comes to normal everyday computing tasks.Now let's talk about Windows 8 which is the operating system.  I hate it. hate it, hate it, hate it.  Unfortunately doesn't matter what kind of computer you get they all pretty much have it now.  Operating system aside though, this is a pretty good machine for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good notebook to mail and browse
Reviews.Author: Uwe Schaub
Reviews.Content: I like it, because it is good for mailing, browsing, skyping and working with office, as same as I expected.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value machine
Reviews.Author: Michael McGrail
Reviews.Content: Great machine for the price. Bought it just before Christmas and was so pleased with it looked to buy another for my son in January and the price had gone up b y $150 so we got a great bargain the first time around.I have no issue with the finish and doesn't look cheap to me as some have commented.Does what it says on the tin. Ideal for basic internet, email and gaming. No complaints - only wish I'd bougtht two at the time!

Reviews.Title: Asus 15.6 in laptop
Reviews.Author: Dean Heimlich
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the unit's quality and appearance. For my daughter's use and no complaints from her. She can't get away from it.

Reviews.Title: This Computer was a bargain for the price. Thank you, Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Desert Sailor "Fish Man"
Reviews.Content: This is another Superior Asus laptop for a bargain price. I am completely satisfied with it! It was Exactly as advertised!

Reviews.Title: Fine, inexpensive laptop with loose keys
Reviews.Author: Jean E. Pouliot
Reviews.Content: After changing jobs, my wife needed a laptop to write letters, watch movies and surf the net. But money being what it is (usually in short supply) we opted for this ASUS laptop. The delivery from Amazon was quick, and the computer arrived on our doorstep in a few days. An interesting way to shop for a computer! Setup was very easy, and the laptop has functioned very well.A few complaints: less than a month after delivery, the Tab and Caps Lock keys came off! Looking at the surprisingly complex, interlocking parts under the keys, it seems that a couple of tiny pins had broken. We aren't sure whether this happened in manufacturing, or delivery or from (very gentle) home use. After consulting with an online guide for replacing keys (and after 3 hours of sweating over the tiny pieces) I got one key back on completely and the other back on most of the way. The device is workable, but I suspect that I will eventually have to replace the two keys completely.Note that the ASUS laptop is bare bones. It comes with a power supply, but not a mouse.We got what we paid for: an inexpensive working laptop, with a few flaws, that functions well (after one month, cross fingers!) as an in-home computer.

Reviews.Title: thanks
Reviews.Author: denys portieles
Reviews.Content: I think it's an excellent product, fast shipping. I have no complaints. I like to have more products like these. right now I'm using to write this note

Reviews.Title: My son loves this new laptop!!!
Reviews.Author: William L. Pettingill
Reviews.Content: Got this for my son for Christmas. Every time I ask him he states he loves his new ASUS laptop!!!

Reviews.Title: Good computer for the price.
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: First off, the laptop itself came beautifully packaged and on time.Secondly, I have had this laptop for almost 3 days now and the review I give is based solely on these days and things may or may not change with time.Pros:-Full sized keyboard-Visually appealing-Fans are quiet and work well-On key shortcuts-HDMI port-Quality microphone-Decent cameraCons:-VERY loud dvd drive-Casing gets oily from fingers-It's kind of slow [may be due to windows 8 and my inability to work properly with it yet]-HeavyOverall it's a very nice computer for the price and I really wasn't expecting that. I converted from a macbook to this laptop but I would suggest anyone who is inexperienced with computers or windows to get windows 7 instead of 8 although given time 8 would definitely be more user friendly but it's really hard to get used to and if you don't know what you are doing it might make it close to impossible to actually use the laptop. I give this computer a 4/5 because it does have some flaws but if you are looking for a basic laptop to do basic things this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer
Reviews.Author: Hester
Reviews.Content: I have purchased 2 of these laptops, one for myself about 18mo ago and one for my mom for Christmas 2012. Very powerful, nice display, fast, and ASUS offers massive cloud storage for free. When my husband is ready for an upgrade I know he'll want an ASUS.

Reviews.Title: A Good buy
Reviews.Author: Ankit
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this laptop with windows 7. So far I really like it. I am not a computer geek. I just need a laptop for internet browsing and using Microsoft office applications. This computer's configuration are ideal for that. The laptop has an intel B 970 processor which is dual core and is pretty fast (>2Ghz). Windows 7 lets you download Microsoft Security Essential, an anti spy software for free, which means you don't have to purchase an expensive anti virus program. The laptop is pretty light, but then light is a relative term. I try not to get sucked into details. If you are looking for a good configuration laptop, at $330, this laptop is a good buy. I will not spend $400 on it though, as there are many better configurations for that price.I would definitely recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Mystery fan "stringbean63"
Reviews.Content: I have an ASUS desktop computer which has run BEAUTIFULLY for the past five years!  It's very reliable and except for a few upgrades (RAM) and DVD Burner, it's served me very well for the amount of time I've had it and the amount of use it's been through.  So when it came time to get a new laptop to replace a much older and outdated one I chose an ASUS laptop knowing that I would not be disappointed.  There wasn't much below the $450 price range and I consider myself lucky to find an ASUS which will serve my purposes very nicely.  I've never dealt with Windows 7 before so that's an experience in itself.  I am very happy with the graphics, really, really nice!  I don't know what other people are talking about regarding the speakers, I find them to be quite good.  I admit the built in microphone leaves much to be desired, but that wasn't a main selling point with me, so as far as I'm concerned it's doesn't detract from the laptop itself.  I love the speed!  I can't believe at how quickly Windows comes up and the speed I have surfing the internet.  I even have a game on it an can hardly believe how wonderful it works!.  I did not buy it to be a gaming computer but I am glad it can handle my game of choice.  Mainly it's for my genealogy research, music, and pictures.I could have wished that the hard drive was larger, but 320GB is still plenty of space for me to work with.  It has 4 GB of RAM which can be upgraded to 8 GB so there's some room for expansion.  The battery doesn't last very long, just a couple of hours which is okay.  All in all it's a great computer and I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: beast
Reviews.Author: leona
Reviews.Content: I purchased this ASUS laptop for my husband. i knew it would be decent i had no idea it would be so awesome. i recommend this system.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Danisoid
Reviews.Content: I just bought this laptop for our business - mostly email, web and Quickbooks, and so far I cannot complain about what we got for the price we paid - $329. The machine is quite fast, quiet and the keyboard is actually not bad at all except for some of the upper row keys that are fairly small. We bought the Win7 version, so I cannot comment on the Win8 level of comfort.The biggest issue is the battery life which is miserable - 2 hours at best. So not a machine for the road.It is quite light mostly because of the heavy use of plastics. Overall a good cheap laptop for everyday use. Not sure how it will fire on the long run.

Reviews.Title: the right size
Reviews.Author: Lin Rodenberg
Reviews.Content: works good it is a little slow on some things I keep loosing the browser conedtion but thats probbly not the computor.  its a good unit for the price

Reviews.Title: Computer for Christmas
Reviews.Author: Jlyon
Reviews.Content: So far everything is as expected.  I give five stars knowing that electronics usually show their issues later than the first week of use.  We researched this purchase and all things I have read, are so far holding true.  I am finding Windows8 to be a little more difficult to get used to than I had hoped.  Very fast shipping and great price.

Reviews.Title: Its a labtop
Reviews.Author: missyk
Reviews.Content: I'm not a huge fan of laptops, it was for my husband. But I've used it and compared to others this one is good. It does everything a laptop/ computer should do. so for the price its a good pick

Reviews.Title: great computer!!!
Reviews.Author: sailinron "sailinron"
Reviews.Content: great computer better than i expected  easy to start up and use right out of the box would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: As expected
Reviews.Author: Megan Landon
Reviews.Content: I'm downloading programs onto it right now and comig from an acer, the new features just take a little bit of adjustment (touch pad). Great sound and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great PC
Reviews.Author: T. Buhrman
Reviews.Content: Works terrific & made my 13 year olds Christmas bright. Runs fast & the screen is big, he likes the number keys being placed off to the right side too. A good computer

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Laptop display. The battery lasts a long time too which is great for me, as a a student, to write papers or do online work wherever so I'm not always stuck at a desk or the library.

Reviews.Title: Performer at a great price
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: I picked this up during the Lightening Deals sale, and I'm very satisfied.  Quick startup, easy to navigate, very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Owen
Reviews.Content: Product is value for money. This is good for someone who needs a Computer for work and pleasure and cannot afford anything over $400. Hard is suitable and fast, capable of upgrade.

Reviews.Title: A Gift for Hubby
Reviews.Author: B. A. Hair
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop as a Christmas gift for my hubby.  And though he complained that he didn't NEED a laptop, guess who's on it every single night....  : )

Reviews.Title: Great laptop! Especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Sherry Wing
Reviews.Content: This is quite similar to my previous laptop, which was new, but was about double the price. I just received this in the mail today and everything is as I was hoping. It's light weight and seems to be good quality. I've heard good things about this brand too, so I figured I would try it out for my first time. The only small issue, is that the speaker volume isn't that great. My last laptop could play much louder, but I think for the price, that's a very minor thing for me. I could probably just buy some lil speakers or something if I care enough later. Otherwise, absolutely great so far!

Reviews.Title: nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Trish Way "Trish Way"
Reviews.Content: My son is enjoying the laptop. It was awesome to find it on the lighting deals. We had been looking for a good deal for awhile.

Reviews.Title: Gift for the wife. Got it set-up and loaded with her software. Wrapped under the tree.
Reviews.Author: Norseman
Reviews.Content: Got it set-up and loaded with her software. Wrapped under the tree.Wanted WIN7 and this was one of the last notebooks with "7".

Reviews.Title: Not a bad, simple, little laptop
Reviews.Author: rk
Reviews.Content: I was able to pick this laptop up on a Gold Box sale.  I had an HP that died on me a few months ago, and it was almost the same to buy this, as it was to get the HP fixed.My main complaint is not with the laptop, but the OS.  Yes, I am a Win 8 hater.  I gave it a try, but after a couple of hours all I wanted was my 'Start' button (without jumping through hoops).  Since I already had Win 7  on my broken laptop, I pulled the drives and swapped them.  I can tell you that swapping drives was fairly painless.  The drive has a bracket on it with standard screw holes, so I made quick work of it.  Booted in Bios a couple of times to set up the drive, reactivated Windows, and it works like a champ.  Maybe I'll put and SSD drive in it in a year or so.The screen is very nice.  The speakers are a little tinny, but it is a laptop.There are only 2 USB ports on the laptop.  I wish laptop makers would move away from VGA plugs.  I used a HDMI to DVI cable to hook it to a monitor and it works great.  If you plan on using any accessories (external mice, keyboards, USB drives, etc), I would suggest getting a dedicated USB hub.  I am pushing a second external monitor using a USB video card, and it works fine.CPU is a little underpowered if you are a heavy users.  I use the laptop for web surfing, Amazon videos, and it is fine.  Also, as noted in other reviews THERE IS ONLY ONE RAM SLOT.  I am waiting on my single 8GB DIMM now.  The 4GB DIMM installed is a DDR3-1600 (12800).  I needed the extra boost to run some work apps (VPN, Notes). 4GB should be fine for the casual user.Overall, I give it a recommend.  If you can pick it up in the Gold Box specials, it's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Maria Montero
Reviews.Content: Plenty of storage space, fast processor, enough ram memory, stylish design and affordable price. There are now 4 of this owned by members of my family and all of us are happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent computer, excellent price.
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Computer is lightweight, solid. Standard keyboard, has nice touch. Excellent price for the product. Battery life relatively short, but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Lee Geiger
Reviews.Content: I have another Asus Windows 7 computer a little smaller, they are both much alike, this one is faster, but gets 4 hours to a battery charge, the little one running 1.65 gigs is a bit slower, but I get 5.9 hours per charge. As for the keyboard, there are so many keys,on the 15.6 inch laptop, it is hard to find the delete key without looking for it. The little 13.3 Asus windows 7 computer has a basic keyboard, not so many keys, but it is easy to find everything.  Both Asus computers have a great screen clearness, colors are wonderful, They both run flawlessly, I cannot tell you that either is better, but if you like a big screen, this one is great. I still favor my little 13.3, but that is a matter of preference. I bought this because the cheap priced Dell, crashed & eventually I should have it going again, but ex wife needs it for the college courses, I figured that this will be dependable, but if she still likes her old xp Dell, it is just as fast but on a smaller screen, & the other one will be a spare. College programs destroy good computers, they constantly fill it with ad ware. My job is to keep them cleaned out so they can do their work. Son is in college too.  So while she (grandma) is doing college on one computer, she uses the other for references & for look up. I think that two computers side by side are a great way to getting things done. Some people may complain about the black surface smudges, but my concern is what the computer will do, & how much trouble will it cause me. I think I will treasure my windows 7 computers for a long time, they work better than any other computers lately. I also have an old Asus 9 inch Linux Ubuntu computer, it is only 900mhz but it is really quick at the coffee shops. The problem that I have is that it is difficult to upgrade, & it needs an old wifi to run on.  It's been a while since I fell in love with these windows 7 Asus computers, this A54C is a very fast computer 2.3 ghz, I get excited clicking on things & it usually keeps up with me. I bought one of these earlier, & now I got another one for me.  Its nice to have a cd drive in it. You can watch movies or load programs so easily. I still like to save things on SD memory chips too. There is a port on the front & the sound plugs too. The speaker sound is quiet, But this usually stays home, & I have a amplified speaker set really close. Just Don't forget to make backup disks, before you keep it too long, A good windows 7 disk could cost you, when all you have to do is put a blank DVD disk, about 640 megs of setup files run on that, which is your windows, when a computer crashes.  It takes about 4 Disks for your programs & personal stuff, that can be saved for all of the rest.  Grandma has claimed the other A54C computer for her college work, she says that the computer can do everything she asks for it to do, all by itself. I also like the nice clear screen too. Colors are sharp, but I am getting spoiled, I feel that all other computers have a dull screen.  I have owned this computer one week, grandma had hers one month, she uses hers for college, I just play on mine. I have encountered confusion that when I type that occasionally when I type the curser jumps back & writes on a previous spot, I am clumsy, & I feel that I am bumping another key which causes this. But as far as an adventure in computing, I am having more fun with this computer, than I have had in 15 years of computing. I love music, & I just upgraded my NoteWorthy Composer program that I had for 12 years. I can create midis, It now has a keyboard on the note page. It makes writing songs much easier than the original program.  I love word web, my computer dictionary program, it helps me to spell, or look up words, but its much styled like the old dictionary. This laptop has a big screen, yet is light enough to compete with the light weights. Its strong enough that I don't believe that anything will fall apart. I am not a gamer & I do not expect the ultimate in speed, but as far as 2.3 ghz, it is fast enough to keep me happy.  I have decided that my clumsy fingers on the keyboard was not the only problem, I tried a tablet keyboard usb, & everything worked fine, I finally decided that it needed another keyboard, if you need replacement, you will have to take a knife, & push each tab up at the top of the keyboard, one at a time & pry it up a little, & then the next tab, the bottom of the keyboard is an aluminum plate. You have to take notice of the keyboard ribbon before you order a new one, one ribbon points straight up, the other points up & curves to the left. There are two different keyboards that might fit, this is how you tell the difference. My first Asus linux had a bad key from one drop of water, so now that this keyboard developed a defect, it is easy to switch out,& only $20, they all are the same in that respect. If the keyboard seems springy, it is possible that it may have been bent in shipment, the foundation under the keyboard is solid.  I replaced the keyboard, & notified the keyboard company that the flimsy box allowed the keyboard to get bent & that they needed an additional box containing the first box. Even though, I bent it back the best I could, it still shows some ripple, & I told the company that their fine quality keyboard looks cheap, when it gets bent in shipment.  The curser line jumping to other lines has improved, since changing the keyboard. Normally you only replace the keyboard when only a few drops of water, disables certain letters, from working anymore.

Reviews.Title: I am describing for three asus laptops
Reviews.Author: shortglide
Reviews.Content: I have now had three asus  laptops. All three sucked with all the problems I've had. Start with the ach model, lt wouldn't let me type anything to sign into windows. the 2nd one an  F55! the you couldn't scroll the page up or down or side to side, the third F55! the pointer would freeze up on me.  Amazon, however with their great customer service, grade mt to  an HP , which I love. Asus is supposed to be top of the line computer but not for me, 1 ach and 2 F55A, all three have defects you decide.

Reviews.Title: Arrived DOA - graphics card defective!
Reviews.Author: Martialm
Reviews.Content: Ordered this next day air for Xmas and it arrived non functional. Now I have to return it and pray they get me a good one before Xmas....I hope this experience doesn't bode badly for Asus quality, but as of now, it sucks!!What happened to quality control?

Reviews.Title: Pay Little, Get Little
Reviews.Author: That Wilkin Boy
Reviews.Content: Unit looks and feels cheap, which is pretty much a given at this price point.This particular unit had a dead hard drive right out of the box.  It was returned via Amazon's excellent return policy.  We'll not be taking the chance on another one.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy from ASUS
Reviews.Author: McKenna
Reviews.Content: I thought wow under $500 for a decent computer!! Boy was I wrong, after 3 months this computer broke, the boot disc just stopped working effectively rendering the compute unusable. Of course it was still under warranty so, I contacted ASUS at which point they gave me an RMA to return it to them to be repaired. That suited me. However, I had to follow up with them multiple times and they kept saying to me that the progress was good and the computer would be returned "soon". Well, 5 months later the computer was returned to my doorstep still broken. I contacted them immediately to inquire about this... They informed me that they had no idea why that would happen and also stated that they had never spoken to me before. I said that this was interesting because there was a label from their warehouse and the RMA was still attached to the box. I did some research and found out that this company often "loses" computers that they agree to fix. I decided that I did not want to return the computer to them again just to wait another 5 months for it to come back broken again. this would effectively void the 1 year hardware warranty. So, I told them I wanted a refund. That did not work, they gave me another RMA and asked me to return it again. I said that this was unacceptable and contacted AMAZON. Amazon has been GREAT and taken care of all of my needs. Thanks AMAZON!! Please save yourself the struggle and do not purchase from ASUS.

Reviews.Title: Asus + Windows 8 = awful!
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Hughes
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what is worse - Asus or Windows 8 - but together they are definitely awful! It is just a slow, painful, clunky experience with continuous hiccups. I recently gave it to my 15 year old son for homework etc. but less than a week later his verdict was practically the same as mine. He is going to work and save over the Summer to buy another laptop. I just bought a Toshiba laptop with Windows 7 on Amazon this evening, after various recommendations, and hope this is a better overall experience!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy~
Reviews.Author: julie rockey
Reviews.Content: Just opened this computer 4/10/13 from buying it on black friday.  It's slow as malassas. I wish I opened it earlier and could return it.

Reviews.Title: arrived brokedn
Reviews.Author: David Read
Reviews.Content: I would have like it a lot, but when it arrived, right out of the box, the Q and W keys did not work.  I couldn't even enter the product key for windows and begin using the product.

Reviews.Title: Not great...
Reviews.Author: TC5953
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for work purposes and it has been VERY glitchy.  It clicks on things that I am not selecting, that the mouse is not even near.  It shuts down on me all the time and takes a minimum of 30 minutes to come back up due to 'updates'.  It randomly freezes to the point that I have to pull the battery to get it to work again.  I would not buy this again.  Nor would I buy it with Windows 8.  That has been another nightmare that I think they should never have made!

Reviews.Title: my laptop came defective touchpad
Reviews.Author: Manuel Vnzla
Reviews.Content: hello greetings did purchase the laptop ASUS F55A-AH91 15.6-Inch 'but upon receiving the defective wine touchpad I live in Venezuela but did purchase at amazon where I have to carry the equipment for warranty purposes please respond prom

Reviews.Title: Not an excellent, but OK
Reviews.Author: liat
Reviews.Content: I like this computer becuase its weight is low, but Im not pleased with the battery life time.. For the money I paid I think this computer is OK but not excellent.

Reviews.Title: Good for my son
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M. Young
Reviews.Content: It has been great although I did not realize when I purchased it that it did not have an optical drive. I had to get an external.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop, good value
Reviews.Author: Khagindr Atri
Reviews.Content: Though, the cost could have been a little better. This is a good machine, fast efficient. It would have been even nicer if they ioncluded a disk or put the device driver in a partition somewhere. Overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: ASUS F55A-AH91 15.6-Inch Laptop
Reviews.Author: Ish Singh
Reviews.Content: The laptop is great when it comes to impressing through it's hardware that would make it a good rival and it comes preloaded with Windows 8. The body of the laptop comes with a matte finish that is even impressive as it doesn't attract fingerprints and is a stunning design. However with the hardware that it boasts it somehow feels that the OS doesn't do it much justice and while the OS may be new to some users my preference would've been to have Windows 7 loaded instead of the shipped OS hence the reason for 4 stars.Other than such the laptop is impressive, if you bought it, my first recommendation would be to get the OS changed to something more comfort friendly and that would take advantage of the hardware features without the lag.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Jttrail0
Reviews.Content: Prob not worth the cheap price, doesn't operate like two gigs and keys broke the second day I had it.

Reviews.Title: One Complaint...
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I've had about this product is that the one I received, when I attempted to upgrade the ram, the slot was backwards compared to most other models I've worked on.  I returned what I thought was a defective laptop, only to receive another with the same defect.  I called ASUS direct technical support and they said they would look at it but it would take 10-14 days so I just gave up on upgrading the RAM.

Reviews.Title: what's going on?
Reviews.Author: Arinze Okafor
Reviews.Content: How could one place an order for a laptop for a disadvantaged college student as a gift since March and 2 months later, it has not been received.  It is wrong and unfair and I am reluctantly writing this review which ordinarily I wouldn't have if I had a phone number to call.  What an experience!

Reviews.Title: wifi is horrible
Reviews.Author: JCK
Reviews.Content: wifi is horrible the rest is great. i had to purchase a micro usb wifi adapter . . . .

Reviews.Title: UPDATED: Christmas Eve Disappointment
Reviews.Author: M. Quinones
Reviews.Content: THIS IS AN UPDATE TO MY EARLIER REVIEW BELOW:We tried connecting the laptop to another WIFI connection in a friend's home and it worked.  Then we also tried connecting with ethernet at home.  It worked.  So we determined the problem HAD to be our internet/cable company.  We called Comcast and they connected remotely to the laptop and changed some settings ON THE COMPUTER which allowed the laptop to recognize and connect to my home network.  Problem is solved.....so we are keeping the laptop.  But I can't give it more than 3 stars because I'm not personally using the laptop.  I'm sticking with my MacBook Pro!  :o)**********After researching laptops for my teenager (and reading several outstanding reviews), I decided on this notebook as a Christmas present for my son so he would have his own and stop using my MacBook pro.  He opened it and we started to set it up but there was an issue with connectivity to our WIFI.  It kept saying that it was connected to my home network but then also said, "no internet access".  After several reboots, troubleshooting attempts, resetting modem, etc., I finally called support and was surprised to find someone to help me on Christmas Eve.  We spent 1 1/2 hours on the phone troubleshooting and as a last resort setting the notebook back to its factory settings.  Nothing.  Could not figure out the problem, especially since my MacBook and other wireless devices in the home were connected with no issue.  Needless to say, I'm frustrated and have decided to return the computer and find a different one.  I even Googled the problem and it appeared that there were numerous forums about this very issue (connected, but "no internet access") and some seem to believe it is a Windows 7 issue?  When I mentioned the many forums to the tech on the phone, he stated that I was the first person he heard of to have this issue.  I guess that's why he couldn't help me further.Oh well.  Back to the factory and back to Square One.  Spending 1 1/2 hours on the phone on Christmas Eve was enough for me to be completely turned off by this 'supposedly great brand'....and now I have to go back to sharing my laptop until I find another one.  Arrrrrgh.The real bummer is that I bought it a week ago and it's been sitting under the tree since then.  I should have opened it and tried setting up to make sure everything worked, then re-boxed and wrapped it.  I could have discovered this problem earlier and possibly still had a laptop for my son in time for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Worse ASUS Laptop ever.
Reviews.Author: Anson King
Reviews.Content: The audio is very low on this laptop, my Samsung S11 phone plays audio files louder than this. Altec Lansing failed badly with this speaker.Battery does not last too long. This is my third ASUS laptop I've got 2 ASUS A53U-XE1 for my kids and they are very fast and loud compared to this.Update: Jan 18th 2013,I was contacted by an ASUS rep after writing the review with some technical advice none of which works, I installed VLC player and tweaked it a bit so I am able to get a little more audio now. Lately whilst watching movies on VLC I have noticed a lot of ghosting thought it was the program but on WMP it is also happening. I installed Tune Up Utilities 2012 and optimized the system but to no avail. I am dropping my rating of this to one star now.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it.
Reviews.Author: katrina hines
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why people said that products from this company look nice. They look cheap! In fact, they are cheap. I guess I should have seen one in person before ordering this computer online. I was so excited to take it out of the box. It was a surprise to see how low grade the keyboard, cam, mouse pad, plastic around the screen and even the power button was. The computer was also defective right out of the box. I was on the phone for hours with ASUS before they told me to send it back. They told me that for them to fix it or send a new one would take ruffly 3 weeks. I just returned it to Amazon for a refund and bought an HP. The HP is beautiful and has more memory, better graphics card and camera, nicer features and a bigger screen for $20 more.

Reviews.Title: A few days after buying
Reviews.Author: Israel Deago
Reviews.Content: A few days after buying, i am using it and think that it have all that describes, it work really good for me until now, thankz

Reviews.Title: The computer was refurbished and i wouldnt have bought it if that was stated
Reviews.Author: Veronica E. Hanson "Carol"
Reviews.Content: this computer was a gift for my daughter and i was disappointed to find that it was refurbished. Never had that happened on amazon before. now i am in the process of replacing the screen and the charging port. Do be careful when buying electronics. Asus is still my favorite brand but like i said dont buy refurbished computers. Usually used like new from amazon is just an open box item or damaged packaging but this one was a lemon.

Reviews.Title: Not pleased with AMAZON on this one...
Reviews.Author: Lookin' for a lake...
Reviews.Content: I understand the concept of a lightning deal.  If you hesitate, you lose out.  But in this case, I got in on the deal.  Clicked on place order with the price of $299.99.  Boom, there it is.  Every screen indicated that I got the $299 price.  Finally got a great deal on a laptop.  Then I clicked on review my order and it indicated that I was billed the $359 price.  Customer service would not help.  Poor performance by a typically great company.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Pentium B980 2.4 GHz Processor
4 GB DDR3
320 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen, Intel HD 3000 Graphics
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: ASUS F55A-AH91 15.6-Inch Laptop
